_header: An aged man twice forty years
_description: Walter Kennedy, ‘Ane Aigit Manis Invective against Mouþ þankless’ — seven 8-line stanzas, ababbcbc, including refr. phrase, ‘…mowth thankless’

CamMagPep2553.First Lines:
Ane ageit man twys fourtie ȝeirisEftir þe holie dayis of
                    ȝule…
CamMagPep2553.Last Lines:
…And þis I hard ane auld man raiffEftir þe ȝule
                    of mouthe thankles
CamMagPep2553.Editions:
Ramsay,  Allan,
                        ed.  
             The Ever Green.
         2 vols. Edinburgh, 1724; repr. Ramsay and Early Scottish Poets, London,

Craigie,  William Alexander.

             2 vols. 
             Scottish Text Society
         n.s. 7 (1919), 20 (1927); Edinburgh and London: Blackwood, 1919,
            1927: 1.364-6.

Banna.First Lines:
Ane aigit man twyss twynty fourty ȝeirisEftir the
                    halydayis of ȝule…
Banna.Last Lines:
…all this I hard ane auld man raifeftir þe ȝule of
                    mowth thankless
Banna.Note: Nineteenth-century transcript in Edinburgh,  Edinburgh University Library La.IV.27, Edinburgh,  Edinburgh University Library La.IV.28, item 8.
